### USE CASE

Lets consider we have a mobile application which help users register themselves and upload their COVID-19 test reports. Results of this report could be positive or negative, and some users may have registered but not tested yet. 

When a user is tested positive a case is logged in a case management database, which helps contact tracing team manage their cases. The lifecycle of a case is Open, Assigned, WorkInProgress, and Closed. Contact Tracing team’s primary goal is to identify the contacts made by the user tested positive. As part of the case, they make contact with these exposed people who could be infected and warm them and the risks involved and advice to stay quarantined. The health worked follows up both the patient and the contacts involved in his/her cases frequently and ensure their well-being, and avoid further spread of infection. The team also tracks the area infected and their contamination level.



### 1. UML Class Diagram

![Conceptual Model](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45623734/87967471-7bfcc380-cadc-11ea-964f-fd0a46ef2886.png "Conceptual Model")

#### Assumptions 

1: A Person may or may not be tested for COVID-19

2: Assuming infected person remembers the contacts made.

3: Currently, assuming Infected persons have not travelled anywhere due to travel ban/ Lockdown.

4: We are not monitoring the personal relations between Infected person and contacts made.



### 2.	Table definition 


a.	User Profile: - Contains personal information of the Patients/Users/Persons. 

b.	Person: - Specifies if a user is Infected, Not-Infected, Recovered or Exposed to an infected person.  Each user is linked to their personal information table. It also contains basic information collected before Test is conducted for COVID-19. 

c.	Contacts: - This entity gives us the details about the people who have made a direct or an indirect contact with the infected person. 

d.	Areas Exposed: - This entity gives us information about the regions which have been affected by the covid19 virus. One of the key attributes here is the “contamination level”, which tells us about the degree of exposure on a scale of 1 to 5, with 1 being the lowest.

e.	Case Logs: - This entity is designed to keep a record of all the cases which are registered in the application.

f.	Contact Tracing Team: - This entity gives us information about the health workers who are working on different cases which are present with an active/open status in the case logs.

g.	Test Reports: - This entity contains COVID-19 test reports of  the users who have taken the test. It has an attribute called result, which gives us the information that which all patients have been infected by the virus.

h.	Testing Facility: - This entity contains the details the labs which are involved in the testing of the patients.

### 4.	Definition of relational schema with proof that it is in BCNF.

Functional Dependencies:-


a.	Contact Table

contactId -> user1Id, user2Id, dateOfContact, riskFactor.

b.	Investigation Table

investigationId -> contactId, caseId.

c.	ContactTractingTean Table

empId -> employeeName, phoneNumber, email.

d.	Person Table

userId -> userType, sysmtopmsOnsetDate, firstTest , employedInHealthCare, symptoticAsSpecifiedByCDC, hospitalized , ICU  , residentInCongregateCareSetting, pregnant, dateContactedByTracingTeam.

e.	TestReport

testReportID -> userID, testFacilityID, testDate, resultDate, result, caseID, device.

f.	CaseLog Table

caseId -> currentStatus, empId.

g.	UserProfile Table

userID -> firstName, lastName, phoneNumber, DOB, sex, email, areaID.

h.	TestFacility Table

testFacilityID -> facilityName, licenseNumber, phoneNumber, address, zip.

i.	CaseLogArea Table

caseLogAreaId -> caseId, areaID.

j.	Area Table

areaID -> zipCode, city, state, country, contaminationLevel.

In the tables above, 

-	Every attribute is atomic.
-	Attributes are not partially dependent on candidate key/ composite key.
-	There are no transitive dependencies within the attributes, they were resolved by creating separate entities. 
-	Every attribute of a table is determined only by its primary key. No other prime attribute can be used to derive non-prime        attribute. Hence, the tables satisfy 1NF, 2NF, 3NF and are in BCNF . 


### Database Schema- CREATE TABLE COMMANDS


```{inlcude=TRUE}

CREATE TABLE PERSON (
    userId    INT AUTO_INCREMENT,
    userType    VARCHAR(20),
    symptomsOnsetDate    DATE,
    firstTest    VARCHAR(10) ,
    employedInHealthCare    VARCHAR(10),
    symptoticAsSpecifiedByCDC    VARCHAR(10) ,
    hospitalized    VARCHAR(10) ,
    ICU    VARCHAR(10) ,
    residentInCongregateCareSetting    VARCHAR(10) ,
    pregnant    VARCHAR(10) ,
    dateContactedByTracingTeam    DATE,
    CONSTRAINT PRIMARY KEY( userId ),
    CONSTRAINT CHECK (userType IN ("Infected","Not-Infected","Recovered","Exposed")),
    CONSTRAINT CHECK (firstTest IN ("Yes","No","Unknown")),
    CONSTRAINT CHECK (employedInHealthCare IN ("Yes","No","Unknown")),
    CONSTRAINT CHECK (symptoticAsSpecifiedByCDC IN ("Yes","No","Unknown")),
    CONSTRAINT CHECK (hospitalized IN ("Yes","No","Unknown")),
    CONSTRAINT CHECK (residentInCongregateCareSetting IN ("Yes","No","Unknown")),
    CONSTRAINT CHECK (pregnant IN ("Yes","No","Unknown")),
    CONSTRAINT CHECK (ICU IN ("Yes","No","Unknown"))
);


CREATE TABLE AREA (
    areaId    INT AUTO_INCREMENT,
    zipCode VARCHAR(100),
    city    VARCHAR(100), 
    state    VARCHAR(100), 
    country    VARCHAR(100),
    contaminationLevel INT ,  
    PRIMARY KEY( areaId ),
    CONSTRAINT CHECK (contaminationLevel between 1 and 5)
);

CREATE TABLE TestFacility ( 
		    testFacilityID Integer primary key,
                            facilityName Text,
                            licenseNumber varchar(100),
                            phoneNumber VARCHAR(100),
                            address Text,
                            zip VARCHAR(100));

CREATE TABLE ContactTracingTeam (
		        empID Integer primary key,
                                employeeName varchar(100),
                                phoneNumber VARCHAR(100),
                                email varchar(100));


CREATE TABLE CaseLog (
		caseID Integer primary key,
                        currentStatus Text not null,
                        empID Integer,
                        foreign key FCL_CT (empID) references ContactTracingTeam(empID),
                        constraint chk_currentStatus check (currentStatus in ("Open", "Closed","WorkInProgress", "Assigned")));

CREATE TABLE TestReport (
		    testReportID Integer PRIMARY KEY,
                            userID Integer,
                            testFacilityID Integer,
                            testDate Date,
                            resultDate Date,
                            result Text NOT NULL,
                            caseID Integer,
                            device Text,
                            foreign key FTR_P (userID) references Person(userID),
                            foreign key FTR_TF (testFacilityID) references TestFacility(testFacilityID),
                            foreign key FTR_CL (caseID) references CaseLog(caseID),
                            constraint chk_result check (result in ("Positive", "Negative")));



CREATE TABLE CONTACT (
    contactID    INT AUTO_INCREMENT,
    user1Id    INT NOT NULL, 
    user2Id    INT NOT NULL,
    riskFactor    INT , 
    DateOfContact    DATE,
    PRIMARY KEY( contactID ),
    CONSTRAINT FC_P1 FOREIGN KEY(user1Id) REFERENCES PERSON(userId),
    CONSTRAINT FC_P2 FOREIGN KEY(user2Id) REFERENCES PERSON(userId),
    constraint CHECK (riskFactor>=0 and riskFactor<=5));

CREATE TABLE Investigation (
		    investigationID Integer primary key,
                            contactID Integer,
                            caseID Integer,
                            foreign key FI_C (contactID) references Contact(contactID),
                            foreign key FI_CL (caseID) references CaseLog(caseID));



CREATE TABLE USERPROFILE (
    userId    INT AUTO_INCREMENT,
    firstName    VARCHAR(100), 
    lastName    VARCHAR(100),
    phoneNumber    VARCHAR(100), 
    DOB    DATE,
    sex VARCHAR(20) ,
    email VARCHAR(100),
    areaId INT,
    CONSTRAINT PK1 PRIMARY KEY( userId ),
    CONSTRAINT FUP_P FOREIGN KEY(userId) REFERENCES PERSON(userId),
    CONSTRAINT FUP_A FOREIGN KEY(areaId) REFERENCES AREA(areaId),
    CONSTRAINT CHECK (sex IN ("Female","Male","Transgender","Other")));

CREATE TABLE CASELOGAREA (
    caseLogAreaId    INT AUTO_INCREMENT,
    caseId    INT NOT NULL, 
    areaId    INT NOT NULL,
    PRIMARY KEY( caseLogAreaId ),
    CONSTRAINT FCLA_CL FOREIGN KEY(caseId) REFERENCES CASELOG(caseId),
    CONSTRAINT FCLA_A FOREIGN KEY(areaId) REFERENCES AREA(areaId));




```

### 5.	Data retrievals into R that show that the database functions properly.

#### 1.	Complex Search Criterion 

##### Question - Find out the contact tracing trail for all the people who have tested positive for the month of April 2020, with their case file status as "Open". 


##### Result:


```{r}
query<-paste("with recursive tracing (contactId, user1Id, user2Id) as (
  select     contactId,
             user1Id,
             user2Id
  from       CONTACT
  where      user1Id IN (SELECT PERSON.userId FROM PERSON,TestReport,CaseLog 
							WHERE PERSON.userId=TestReport.userId AND TestReport.caseID=CaseLog.caseID 
                            AND TestReport.result='Positive' 
                            AND CaseLog.currentStatus='Open' 
                            AND testDate BETWEEN '2020-04-01' AND '2020-04-30')
  union all
  select     c.contactId,
             c.user1Id,
             c.user2Id
  from       CONTACT c
  inner join tracing
          on c.user1Id = tracing.user2Id
)
select * from tracing;")
rs = dbSendQuery(ctDb,query)
dbRows<-dbFetch(rs)
dbRows
```



#### 2.	Clause Query
		
##### Question - Find the countries with the number of cases more than or equal to 3

##### Result – 



```{r}
query<-paste("	SELECT  area.country, count(CaseLog.caseID) as 'Number of Cases'
 FROM 	CaseLog 
INNER JOIN CaseLogArea on CaseLogArea.caseid = CaseLog.caseid
INNER JOIN Area on Area.areaID = CaseLogArea.areaID 	
GROUP BY Area.country having count(CaseLog.caseID) >= 3;")
rs = dbSendQuery(ctDb,query)
dbRows<-dbFetch(rs)
dbRows
```


#### 3.	Join of 3 tables

##### Question - Find out the number of females tested positive.



##### Result – 



```{r}

query<-paste("	select count(TestReport.result) as 'Number of Females with Positive Cases' from Person inner join USERPROFILE on person.userId = USERPROFILE.userId inner join TestReport on TestReport.userID = PERSON.userID where TestReport.result='Positive' and USERPROFILE.sex='Female' Group by USERPROFILE.sex;")

rs = dbSendQuery(ctDb,query)
dbRows<-dbFetch(rs)
dbRows

```



#### 4.	Sub Query

##### Question - Find the people who are currently infected and were working in healthcare.

##### Result – 



```{r}
query<-paste("	SELECT userId from PERSON where userType IN  (select userType from PERSON where employedInHealthCare='Yes' and userType='Infected')	")
rs = dbSendQuery(ctDb,query)
dbRows<-dbFetch(rs)
dbRows
```



#### 5.	Query of choice 

##### Question - List the Employee IDs and the number of cases of 					those employees with more than 1 case in 'Work in progress' status.

##### Result – 



```{r}
query<-paste("	SELECT ContactTracingTeam.empID,COUNT(CaseLog.caseID) as 'Number of Cases' from ContactTracingTeam LEFT JOIN CaseLog ON CaseLog.empId=ContactTracingTeam.empId
		where CaseLog.currentStatus ='WorkInProgress'
		group by ContactTracingTeam.empID
		having COUNT(CaseLog.caseID)>1
		order by CaseLog.empID asc;	")
rs = dbSendQuery(ctDb,query)
dbRows<-dbFetch(rs)
dbRows
```

```{r}
query<-paste("CREATE VIEW FINDCONTACT1
AS 
with recursive tracing (contactId, User1, User2, Level) as (
  select     contactId,
             user1Id,
             user2Id,
             1 LEVEL
  from       CONTACT
  where      user1Id IN (SELECT PERSON.userId FROM PERSON,TestReport,CaseLog 
                            WHERE PERSON.userId=TestReport.userId AND TestReport.caseID=CaseLog.caseID 
                            AND TestReport.result='Positive'
                            AND testDate BETWEEN '2019-04-01' AND '2021-04-30')
  union all
  select     c.contactId,
             c.user1Id,
             c.user2Id,
             LEVEL + 1
  from       CONTACT c
  inner join tracing
          on c.user1Id = tracing.user2Id
)
select * from tracing ORDER BY LEVEL;")
rs = dbSendQuery(ctDb,query)
dbRows<-dbFetch(rs)
dbRows
```

```{r}

## insert Test Report
Drop Procedure if exists insertTestReport;
DELIMITER $$
CREATE Procedure insertTestReport(
                            IN userID Integer,
                            IN testFacilityID Integer,
                            IN testDate Date,
                            IN resultDate Date,
                            IN result Text ,
                            IN caseID Integer,
                            IN device Text)
	   BEGIN
       -- Set transaction isolation level serializable;
       START TRANSACTION;
       IF (testDate <= resultDate)
	
       then
            IF  result ='POSITIVE' THEN
				
				INSERT INTO TESTREPORT (userId, testFacilityId, testDate, resultDate,result,caseId,device) VALUES (userId, testFacilityId, testDate, resultDate,result,caseId,device);
                If resultDate > (select MAX(resultDate) from TestReport where TestReport.userID = userID) 
				then 	
					UPDATE PERSON SET USERTYPE='INFECTED' WHERE PERSON.USERID=userID;
					UPDATE CONTACT SET RISKFACTOR = 'HIGH'  WHERE (CONTACT.USER1ID= userID OR CONTACT.USER2ID=userID) AND (Contact.dateOfContact > resultDate);
				END IF;
			ELSE
				
				INSERT INTO TESTREPORT (userId, testFacilityId, testDate, resultDate,result,caseId,device) VALUES (userId, testFacilityId, testDate, resultDate,result,NULL,device);
				If resultDate > (select MAX(resultDate) from TestReport where TestReport.userID = userID)
                then
					UPDATE PERSON SET USERTYPE='NOT-INFECTED' WHERE PERSON.USERID = userID;
				END IF;
			END IF;
		Else
			signal SQLSTATE '45000' SET message_text = 'INVALID DATA: Test Date cannot be greater than result date!';
		END IF;
	 COMMIT;
    END$$
DELIMITER ;
```
